text: Pseudopyrausta marginalis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Harrison Gray Dyar Jr. in 1914. It is found in Panama and North America, where it has been recorded from Alaska, Quebec, Texas and Wisconsin.Moth Photographers Group at Mississippi State University The wingspan is 14–15 mm. Adults are on wing from May to November.Bug Guide ==References== Category:Moths described in 1914 Category:Pyraustinae
title: Pseudopyrausta marginalis
